metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25686 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in dnsmasq before version 2.83. When receiving a query, dnsmasq does not check for an existing pending request for the same name and forwards a new request. By default, a maximum of 150 pending queries can be sent to upstream servers, so there can be at most 150 queries for the same name. This flaw allows an off-path attacker on the network to substantially reduce the number of attempts that it would have to perform to forge a reply and have it accepted by dnsmasq. This issue is mentioned in the "Birthday Attacks" section of RFC5452. If chained with CVE-2020-25684, the attack complexity of a successful attack is reduced. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data integrity.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-25686` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.82-1ubuntu2
dnsmasq-base - 2.82-1ubuntu2
dnsmasq-base-lua - 2.82-1ubuntu2
dnsmasq-utils - 2.82-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.82-1ubuntu2').
